metadata.title: CVE-2023-3812 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s TUN/TAPdevice driver functionality in how a user generates a malicious (too big)networking packet when napi frags is enabled. This flaw allows a local userto crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-206.217').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1').
